Happy Halloween! Today's #InsideOut issue covers YouTube TV's deep dive into our consumption habits, Snapchat's new features (including one called Ghost Mode), and Chinese investment fund rumors in Silicon Valley.
If you're not yet subscribed, you can do that here bit.ly/2pATHHD.
It’s a brand new Tuesday, so we have a roundup of top tech stories from the past week. Quorum, J.P. Morgan’s blockchain technology, will now
power the interbank payment processing network, Facebook Spaces is bringing emotional experiences to users, and blockchain could be the solution for red tape when it comes to energy management.
Sign up for #InsideOut here: http://bit.ly/2pATHHD and visit the archive here: http://bit.ly/2xMmbUd

Science builds, buys and invests in disruptive mobile media, marketplace and commerce companies.  Science systematically scales Internet brands and media companies into market leaders through a proven process.

Michael is an amazing guy to have met. Mike, it was a pleasure talking to you, and I hope to be doing (big) business with you in the near future!Cheers,David

Mike is entrepreneur of the year in my book.  I have had the advantage of working with many successful executives and the day I met Mike while he was still attending University, I said to myself, this kid is going to rock.  He had recently started his second company and I immediately took the opportunity to work and learn from him.  Over the years I have enjoyed watching his team develop several companies to success.  "Watch this spot!"  as they say...

An inspiring professional, able to work within extremely difficult situations - within large and small organizations. Rosabel orchestrated the Myspace relaunch as well as managed a very challenging press situation throughout her tenure at Myspace. Beyond Rosabel's work with Myspace she personally took time to help guide my development as a public facing executive - going well beyond the duties of her role. I recommend her highly and hope to work with her again.

summary: I build and invest in innovative online and mobile businesses.  I’m interested in mobile media, ecommerce and socially-driven marketplaces.  I’ve spent my career growing businesses ranging from early stage start-ups to private equity backed assets to public media companies.Currently a cofounder and the CEO of Science Inc., where we bring together the best ideas, talent, resources and financing through a centralized platform. We grow and fund businesses that change the way people discover and buy brands (Dollar Shave Club), reshape how content is created and shared (Wishbone), and create economic efficiencies through marketplaces (Famebit, DogVacay). Previously I was the CEO of Myspace, responsible for one of the most high-profile turn-around challenges in the industry, and its ultimate sale to Specific Media on behalf of NewsCorp. I’ve founded, advised, invested and sold numerous businesses returning $500M in successful outcomes for investors, including application platform Userplane (acquired by AOL), Tsavo Media, Movoxx, PeopleMedia and Brizzly. Active early stage investor in over 30 startup businesses including Klout, Betterworks, Formspring, ShoeDazzle and LunchMoney to name a few.Specialties: mobile, media, consumer Internet, business development, business strategy, identifying market opportunities, consumer marketing, product marketing, online subscription, capital raising, strategic alliances, partner management, viral marketing, social, start-ups
